title: Classification of torsion of elliptic curves over quartic fields
abstract:
Let $E$ be an elliptic curve over a quartic field $K$. By the Mordell-Weil
theorem, $E(K)$ is a finitely generated group. We determine all the
possibilities for the torsion group $E(K)_{tor}$ where $K$ ranges over all
quartic fields $K$ and $E$ ranges over all elliptic curves over $K$. We show
that there are no sporadic torsion groups, or in other words, that all torsion
groups either do not appear or they appear for infinitely many non-isomorphic
elliptic curves $E$.
  Proving this requires showing that numerous modular curves $X_1(m,n)$ have no
non-cuspidal degree $4$ points. We deal with almost all the curves using one of
3 methods: a method for the rank 0 cases requiring no computation; the Hecke
sieve, a local method requiring computer-assisted computations; and the global
method, an argument for the positive rank cases also requiring no computation.
We deal with the handful of remaining cases using ad hoc methods.
